pageContext.claim: “Suppression polls. Suppression. Polls are just as fake as the news itself.”
pageContext.analysis: News and polling organizations do not publish "suppression polls," which in Trump's parlance are polls that relay false information to demoralize and dissuade people from voting. The organizations he mentions did find that Hillary Clinton had a slight advantage over Trump leading up to the 2016 election. It was a very close race and Clinton, it should be noted, won the popular vote by 2.1 percentage points.
